New Records: Devon Conway scored 152 not out, his highest ODI score; Rachin Ravindra scored 123 not out, his first century in ODIs; New Zealand's highest team score in the match was 282 for nine; New Zealand won by nine wickets, their highest margin in the match;
Key Match Events: New Zealand won the toss and chose to bowl first; England's batting was dismissed for 282; Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra formed a 255-run partnership, the highest in the match; New Zealand achieved the target with 13 overs to spare;
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand decided to bowl first after winning the toss; England had a batting line-up including Jos Buttler, Joe Root, and Ben Stokes, but Stokes was ruled out due to injury;
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler called the performance 'completely outplayed'; Joe Root admitted England were 'below par' in all departments; Rachin Ravindra expressed gratitude for his debut performance and partnership with Devon Conway;
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a repeat of the 2019 World Cup final; New Zealand's victory ended England's four-year reign as World Cup champions; the quick nature of the win highlighted New Zealand's dominance;
Others: The match was played at the Narendra Modi Stadium, the largest cricket stadium in the world; the article provided detailed live updates and match statistics;
